Posts.Content: Dec 2, 2011 05:14AM traceyk wrote: My liver enzymes were also fine all through chemo.  Both the first and second time - I have had breast cancer twice - two different primaries in each breast.  During my second round of chemo I developed a blood clot at the site of my port and started tinsaparen a blood thinner.  That is the only difference.  Now, since November ( a couple weeks post chemo) my ALT is high and my AST is high.  My oncologist's nurse said it went up today from the last test two weeks ago.  My ALT is 200 and my AST is 148.  They are going to do a liver ultrasound to see what is going on but she scared me when she said it could be cancer again?  Has anyone else had this told to them?  I have tried to research this and mostly found that it could be damage to the liver or that it could be temporary elevations as a result of chemo?
Posts.Title: Elevated liver enzymes after chemo MaryNY ItsStillMe
